text: [Music]
I think that having a healthy
information diet will actually make you
live longer and having a poor
information diet will kill you faster
the first thing that I use the first
piece of software that I use is called
rescue time.com rescue time is awesome
because it measures your intake it's
like it's like a food journal but for
your computer that level of measurement
helps you just develop a habit that
makes it so that you are a conscious
consumer of information how much time
are you actually spending on email how
much time are you giving away to
Facebook and Twitter uh so that you can
go hey wait a minute I spent 10 hours of
my life on Facebook last week maybe it's
time for me to make some some better
decisions in my life the second piece of
software I use that I love I love this
piece of software it's called
sandbox.com sandbox um is a it's a
for-pay subscription service uh but it
it you make your money back on it
instantly it's like uh an advanced spam
filter that basically only puts the
important messages uh up in front of you
only the information that you need to
see is in front of you at any given time
in your email inbox and it takes the
stuff that maybe wasn't so important and
emails you a digest of it at the end of
every day so you can check to see what
it is that you miss but you know it's
coming and it's coming at the end of
every day I think it's great the third
thing I do I think part of living a
healthy information diet is actually
trying to live an adree lifestyle a lot
of people disagree with me on this but I
think advertising is just as expensive
as paying for Content it's just that the
transactional costs are a little bit
more opaque with advertising I'll give
you an example if a Domino's Pizza
commercial convinces you to buy a pizza
instead of cooking dinner in your house
uh that night that's a cost that you've
incurred uh that you you didn't even
realize that you were paying in order to
consume that media and so I don't
believe that Advertising based content
is necessary neily free I don't think
it's fair to call it free if it's
convincing you to buy things that means
it comes with a price so I use ad block
and um on Firefox and chrome uh to to
reduce my exposure to advertising and I
also cut cable so I don't see any uh
television advertisements at all hav't
in years which is you know strange for
barroom conversations sometimes when
people are laughing at things that I
don't uh that I can't laugh at uh but I
think it's um red reducing my exposure
to television advertis
overall has made me a a much healthier
person as a result
